result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshawn L Baldwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all of the following by the end of supervison. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  DNA surcharges, court costs.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All applicable fees of supervision.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two, three and his Federal Court case; consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with the probation department.
Cooperate with any recommended treatments.

supervisions.notes: Court orders no other specific programing conditions. Defendant must complete a Risk and Needs Assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

12-09-15/ Judge Dennis Cimpl
The Court orderd the JOC shall be amended to include 200 days of sentence credit on counts two and three
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and three and his Federal Court case; consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 200 days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and two and his Federal Court case; consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 200 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshawn L Baldwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (21 pages) commencing NOVEMBER 9, 2015  received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: AS.
Reflects 12-09-15 Court order for 200 days of sentence credit on Counts 2 & 3

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed on 12-09-15.


Pursuant to the Department of Corrections' letter dated December 9, 2015, and State v. Ward, 153 Wis. 2d 743 (Ct. App. 1989), the judgment of conviction shall be amended to include 200 days of credit on counts two and three.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. mag
DOC request to review order for sentence credit.

Counts two and three, Per Order signed on 11/11/2015:
Error-Length of confinement on count two is stated as to 90 days.
          Length of confinement on count three is stated as to 90 days.
CORRECTION:  Length of Confinement on count two is 9 months.
                          Length of Confinement on count three is 9 months.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deshawn L Baldwin in court with attorney James Robert Daniel Rael.  Defendant Deshawn L Baldwin in custody.  Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to all counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS CONCURRENT with Counts 2 & 3; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
As to Count 2: The Court sentence the defendant to 90 days in HOC concurrent with Counts 1 & 3.
As to Count 3: The Court sentence the defendant to 90 days in HOC concurrent with Counts 1 & 2.
These sentences are consecutive to any other sentence and concurrent to his federal court case.
Court grants 200 days credit.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the WI Substance Abuse program.
  Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- Cooperate with any recommended treatments 
- Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.
- Seek and maintain full-time employment 
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay DNA surcharges;
zero restitution
Pay court costs
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Letters of support on behalf of the defendant
Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred.

Attorney James D. Rael in court, defendant Deshawn L Baldwin not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in trial and unable to conduct plea and sentencing today. Spin court is not available.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defense counsel is not available on 9/15/15. Plea and sentencing is adjourned to 9/30/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 35. Counsel to notify ADA, Deputy notified.

Attorney James D. Rael in court, defendant Deshawn L Baldwin not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-15-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Deshawn L Baldwin not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 07-21-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshawn L Baldwin in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Deshawn L Baldwin in custody.  Ronald Dague for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #03CF4464 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Chad Boyack-MPD Officer.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION and electronic monitoring. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deshawn L Baldwin in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Deshawn L Baldwin in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defendant entered pleas of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
